description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android. Google Hardware) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

As the Lead Product Marketing Manager on the Phone and Accessories Marketing team, you will be a member of the core team responsible for one of Google’s most important hardware products. You will be responsible for overseeing our product marketing efforts, focusing on the next generation of smartphones. You’ll work closely with key stakeholders to define positioning and messaging while focusing on awareness, engagement and retention. You will work closely with strategic external partners as well as cross-functional stakeholders across Product, Business Development & Sales, Retail, Legal, Public Relations and the Regional Marketing Teams.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in hardware, product marketing and/or consumer marketing.
  • Experience negotiating with partners to create experiences that support brand and products.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge and understanding of Google Hardware’s strategic and competitive position.
  • Proven track record of exceptional performance and high productivity.
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations, action plans, and campaigns.
  • Able to work in a fast paced, deadline driven, and techy work environment.
  • Analytical mindset with strong quantitative reasoning, creativity and strategic skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Define and evolve phone and accessories product positioning, messaging and branding; work with Product Management, Research and Analytics, Engineering, Sales, Corporate Marketing and Public Relations Teams to define and execute on product launch and adoption strategies.
  • Conduct product research that offers insights into the competition, needs and wants of global consumers and identify product gaps where Google could better satisfy end user needs.
  • Help cross-functional marketing and channel teams to position, message and execute the marketing campaign across multiple touchpoints.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to translate the user needs and wants into product requirements; co-drive long-term product roadmap along with the Product Management and Engineering teams.
title: Lead Product Marketing Manager, Phones
